conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container each liquid will flow into.
The baffles are designed to redirect the flow of the liquid, and the containers (D, E, F, and G) are positioned below the baffles.
Baffle A is pointing towards Container D.
Baffle B is pointing towards Container E.
Baffle C is pointing towards Container F.

premise: Since the liquids are flowing through the baffles, the direction of the liquid flow will be determined by the orientation of the baffles.
conclusion: Baffle A is directed towards Container D, so the liquid from A will flow into Container D.

premise: Baffle B is directed towards Container E.
conclusion: The liquid from B will flow into Container E.

premise: Baffle C is directed towards Container F.
conclusion: The liquid from C will flow into Container F.

premise: The liquid from A will flow into Container D.
conclusion: Liquid from A will flow into Container D.

premise: The liquid from B will flow into Container E.
conclusion: Liquid from B will flow into Container E.

premise: The liquid from C will flow into Container F.
conclusion: Liquid from C will flow into Container F.
Liquid from A will flow into Container D; Liquid from B will flow into Container E; Liquid from C will flow into Container F.
